{{1000,{value@L2M105.ShipText}} {lookup.type.name@{value@OBS.ShipType}}}

Unfortunately the local authorities are too busy to handle this matter at present, so I have transmitted the ships self destruct code.
I suggest if your in the ship you find the nearest airlock, becase in about 10 Sezuras...

[center][select value='Accept']OK[/select][/center]

page.title: L0M19 Return Ship
L2 Buy Used Ship
page.t: I have a used ship for sale. It's in good condition. It's priced at {value.formatted@L2M150.ShipPrice} Credits.
I no longer need my {object.type.name@L2M150.UsedShip} as I have purchased a newer model. I am willing to sell it for {value.formatted@L2M150.ShipPrice} Credits.
I would like to upgrade to a new ship, but I need more Credits. I am willing to part with my reliable {object.type.name@L2M150.UsedShip} for {value.formatted@L2M150.ShipPrice} Credits.

page.title: XTC
page.t: Log me into the Interactive Onboard System!
Welcome to the Onboard Interaction system, please select from the options below.
Connect to Galactic News Service - GNS
Open Mission Logbook
Interactive Onboard System
XTC Team

**Coming Soon - Alone in the Dark**

This start will feature a new mission set, event controllers, generic mission controller and more. For now this start does nothing but dump you in the Plots starting sector, you can play from here just don't expect any additional content over the quick start.

Thanks.

**Coming Soon - The XTC Plot Start**

This start will feature a brand new plot and mission set. For now however this start does nothing but dump you in the Plots starting sector, you can play from here just don't expect to be able to do or find the plot.

Thanks.
Are you requesting help?
Do you require assistance?
Could you give us a helping hand?
It is a delicate matter... our vessel is damaged. Can you help?
What do you need me to do?
What do you need doing?
Okay, I'll do it.
Sure. No problem.
No chance, I have more important things to do!
Generic Tow Mission Briefing
Sure, why not?
Yep!
Hey pilot! Don't you think you forgot something here...?
Return Immobile Ship

We were returning from an undercover intelligence mission when we were attacked by an unknown enemy. We managed to defeat them but we barely survived with our life-support failing and our engines down. We need someone to tow us back to the {object.name@{param@DestName}} in {object.sector.name@{param@DestName}} before we are attacked again. The data we collected must be protected at all costs.
Recover Damaged Ship

Our ship has been seriously damaged whilst engaging hostile ships. Recover {object.name@{param@ShipName}}, {object.code@{param@ShipName}} in sector {object.sector.name@{param@ShipName}} and tow it to the {object.name@{param@DestName}}. Haste is required as we expect the attackers to return soon.
{object.name@{param@ShipName}}, {object.code@{param@ShipName}}
{object.name@{param@ShipName}}, to {object.name@{param@DestName}} in sector {object.sector.name@{param@DestName}}
{object.name@{param@ShipName}}, in {object.sector.name@{param@ShipName}}
{object.name@{param@ShipName}}, to {object.name@{param@DestName}}, {object.sector.name@{param@DestName}}
Recover Heavily Damaged Ship!

Our ship has been seriously damaged whilst engaging hostile ships. Life support and engines are failing. Recover our {object.name@{param@ShipName}}, {object.code@{param@ShipName}} and tow it back to the {object.name@{param@DestName}} in {object.sector.name@{param@DestName}}. I am willing to pay a significant amount of credits for our rescue. Please hurry!
Return Damaged Ship to Homebase

This ship was heavily damaged during an unprovoked attack. Recover {object.name@{param@ShipName}}, {object.code@{param@ShipName}} in sector {object.sector.name@{param@ShipName}} and tow it to the {object.name@{param@DestName}}. We fear the attackers will return soon, so immediate action is required.
{object.name@{param@ShipName}}, {object.code@{param@ShipName}}
{object.name@{param@ShipName}}, to {object.name@{param@DestName}} in sector {object.sector.name@{param@DestName}}
{object.name@{param@ShipName}}, in {object.sector.name@{param@ShipName}}
{object.name@{param@ShipName}}, to {object.name@{param@DestName}}, {object.sector.name@{param@DestName}}

Thank you for your help. Please release us, we can make it from here. A team of technicians has beamed on board and they managed to get minimum shields and engines back online. If you need a helping hand anytime in the future, please don't hesitate to ask us. Good bye my friend!

Emergency Broadcast

 You have failed us... life-support gone...
 The inner reactor core is overloading... going critical...

 Nooooo...!

> Message stream corrupted
This is terrible! The ship you had to protect was destroyed. Keep away from any of our ships in the future... even if they are in desperate need of some help!
You bastu! You destroyed the ship you promised to protect. Our revenge will be swift and merciless!
The destination has been destroyed. Mission aborted.
You failed!

Emergency Broadcast

 To all police forces in this sector. We are being attacked!
 Please help! We are taking damage to our primary thrusters.
 They are over-heating and an explosion is imminent!

 Repeat. To all police forces in this sector.
 Our assailant is a pilot named {player.name}. Please help!
 We are experiencing a feedback loop in our primary thrusters.
 They are going to explode any sezura...

> Message end
We told you before - We can make it from here. You may leave us alone now!
This is your final warning - Leave us alone or you will regret!
That's it! We will now open fire.
Fatal incident in {sector.name@L2M505.OfferSector}

Recently a heavily damaged {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} ship was safely brought home by a merchant named \033W{player.name}\033X during a heroic rescue mission. By risking his own ship and his life, this pilot saved a great deal more than just one of our most important vessels. The {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} are very grateful and wish to thank the noble pilot who showed us the true meaning of honour.

During a hapless attempt to rescue a {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} vessel, the pilot \033W{player.name}\033X failed as it took him too long to reach the {object.name@L2M505.Station} in \033W{sector.name@L2M505.DestSector}\033X. Before he reached them, the stricken ship's reactor containment field breached and caused an immense explosion from which no one survived. We mourn the loss of so many innocent lives.

During an ill-fated attempt to rescue a {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} vessel, the pilot {player.name} failed in his efforts to do so as the ship he had promised to protect was destroyed during the mission. We mourn the loss of many innocent lives.

We can now confirm the reports that a ruthless pilot going by the name of \033W{player.name}\033X recently attacked a heavily damaged {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} vessel in sector \033W{sector.name@L2M505.OfferSector}\033X. They showed no mercy and destroyed the ship without reason killing the entire crew onboard. The {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} will never forget this crime. If you see this bloody bastu out there in space, do what you have to and protect yourself!\n

During an attempt to rescue a heavily damaged {object.name@{param@ShipName}} in sector \033W{sector.name@L2M505.OfferSector}\033X, the pilot \033W{player.name}\033X failed in his mission because his final destination {object.name@L2M505.Station} had been destroyed. The {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} tragically could not manage to get to a repair facility before its reactor exploded. We mourn the loss of so many innocent lives.

The pilot \033W{player.name}\033X failed in an attempt to rescue a {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} vessel. At this very moment we have no further information but we will let you know when we have more news. Our thoughts are with the survivors of the tragedy.

As you might have heard already, an incompetent pilot going by the name of \033W{player.name}\033X has destroyed a heavily damaged {object.name@L2M505.OfferShip} with all hands in sector \033W{object.name@L2M505.OfferSector}\033X during an ill-fated towing attempt with a tractor beam. It appears that there had been insufficient communication between the pilot and the crew of the stranded ship and so the gravity stabilizers had not been fully engaged before \033W{player.name}\033X started his engines and tore the ship apart. All he had to do was talk, nothing more! If you see this bloody bastu out there in space, don't communicate with him... it seems he doesn't believe in it either.

We call pilot \033W{player.name}\033X a worthless chicken! It seems this individual does not have the capacity to show respect for neither life nor property. He rejected all calls for help from the crew aboard a stricken {object.race.name@L2M505.Station} vessel in sector \033W{sector.name@L2M505.OfferSector}\033X. All he had to do was tow the stranded ship back home, but he couldn't be bothered!

Attention! If {player.name} asks for your help at any time, you know what not to do...
The mission to rescue the immobile ship was not completed. For confidential reasons the contract has been aborted, thank you for your assistance.
Deploy Spy Satellites
Offer me my Spy Satellite mission already!
Are you ready for the ultimate challenge? lol
Of course, why else would I be here stupid?
I don't wanna!
Show me!!
Ok mission briefing text goes here
Hello Pilot. Recently we have been losing a large amount of spy satellites in {value@L2500.EnemySector}
Pliot, we are in need of someone with special covert skills. Recently we have been losing an abnormal amount of spy satellites in {value@L2500.EnemySector}
Void Runner
Decision Maker
Needle of Inquiry
Dreamweaver
Pok Claassen
Jako Kult
Calon Marval
Hanes Nedley
Hello Pilot, I have work for you should you be interested, please contact me on the {7216,{value@L2M501.ShipName}}...\n\n{actor.name@L2M501.MissionGuide} Out.
Emergency Supplies?
Chapter 1
Find the Lady

The Duchess of Amoria has gone missing, most likely attacked or destroyed by Pirates. Find either the ship or its wreckage and determine what has happened. If the ship is still intact, render whatever aid is required to get the ship safely back the nearest shipyard. The ship was last seen 2 sectors from here, unfortunately we do not know in which direction... damn Teladi information brokers.
The Chance earn greater rewards
TL The Duchess of Amoria
Dasinos Tzessosis Kokalis VIII (: custom action text}
Data Module (: custom action text}
(: custom action text}
Teladi Trade Station (: custom action text}
Ok, so what can I do for you? (: looking for a job)
You said you have work? What's the deal? (: looking for a job)
Show me... (: briefing trigger)
Lets have the information. (: briefing trigger)
Sounds like this could be interesting, I'll take the Job. (: accept mission)
What!! No chance, I'm out of here. (: reject mission)
Sihoban Kellar
Duchess of Amoria
This is {param@PlayerName}, calling the (param@StrikenShip}.............
What further aid do you need?
Very well, I will get what you need... don't go anywhere, ha ha ha ha!
No thanks, I'll just take my credits and go.
Greetings, I was sent to find you.
Thank you, we need parts for our drive systems can you help?
Oh great, now I'm a delivery service.... what about my 1000 credits?
Of course your reward... a thousand, yes...? Or perhaps you would rather have 5 Wasps?
I'll just take the cash and be on my way to get your engine parts!
Hmmm... 5 Wasps could come in handy, I'll take 'em and your engine parts are coming right up.
Ok pilot, the cash is yours. Don't forget we need those drive parts\n{actor.name@L2M501.DOAContact} Out.
The equipment it is then, thanks. Please hurry back with the engine parts my friend.\n{actor.name@L2M501.DOAContact} Out.

The parts you are looking for might be rather hard to come by around here, however we know that a Teladi by the name of {7216,2501022} has just such the parts we are looking for. I suspect this is not a coincidence and he had something to do with our current situation.
Parts Aplenty?
I understand that you have some engine parts.
Yesss you would like such partssss? Hmmm... they are not for ssssale however I might trade you for them.
Alright, so what do you want for them?
I wisssh for a certain object, a data module from a ssship that wasss desstroyed in a sssector not far from here.
Hmmm... I get it. I go and fetch it and you give me the engine parts... yes? What's the catch?
That issss correct pink ssskin, the engine parts for the module. No catch.
Ok, I guess I have little choice, the module for the parts it is.
You Teladi are all two-faced! Not a chance, get the damn module yourself.
Data Retrieval

Retrieve the data module from sector {sector.name@L2M501.sector2} and return it to {7216,2501022}. Warning:{7216,2501022} is known to be a tricky bastu and it is unlikely that this is a simple as it seems, keep your wits about you.
Pirate Attack Wing
Warning: Pirates have discovered the data module and seem intent in capturing it at all costs... Destroy incoming pirate attack ships.
Return Data Module to {7216,2501022}.
I've got the Data Module, so where's the engine parts?
You have the module good, however it appearssss to be damaged...
And...?
I cannot leave thisss sssstation, you will take it to a colleague for it to be fixed.
I see and if I don't I don't get the engine parts?
Well the module issss no ussssse to me asss it issss. If you are in agreement I will sssend you further inssstructionsss.
Ok, like I have any choice... again! Where is this colleague of yours?
Get lost you trickster. I'm out of here!!
My colleague sssshe issss on the xx ssstation and will be able to fix the data module. Pleassse contact her asss quickly asss posssssible.
Tumulis Holigis Ganatos XVIII
{7216,2501071}, I have a data module that needs repair from {7216,2501022}
What! Oh you come from Dasinossss, I will ssspeak to you...
Right... can you fix this data module?
Yesss, Yessss... but I am expecting "guests". They intend to attack me on this station.
Oh... Ok! I get it! You want me to protect you and this piece of space junk and you'll fix the module... Yes?
The pink sssskin is ssssmart... yessss protect usss and I will fix the module.
Ok here's the module. Intercepting hostiles...
You Teladi are all a pain in the Bastu... go to hell!!
Contact the {7216,{value@L2M501.ShipName}}
Missing TL Located... Targeting
Pirate Wing Destroyed
Data Module Secure... Targeting {7216,2501022} for Delivery
Protect and Serve
{7216,2501071} will repair the data module so long as you protect the Trade Station on which he resides.
Raiders
Pirates Liar
The Start of Something?

Pilot, we need you to fly to a nearby sector and land at a Pirate base. This should present few problems as the pirates are routinely operating from there under the guise of a legitimate business. After docking, you should contact our agent on the base and get the access codes we require.
Dock at
Pirate Station
I see, we will remember this disservice Pilot.\n**{actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide} - Out**

Pirate Pleasure complex. This complex is masquerading as a legitimate Solar Corp Trade station; trading e-cells.\nIn reality, the base is an outpost for the notorious {7216,{value@L2M600.PirateName}} group, trading in death, abduction and everything illegal.
A friend tells me you are looking for a pilot.
I am just confirming your security status... Ok pilot, you check out.
Great, so what's the job?
It'll be easy... are you interested?
Ok, so what's the catch?
A pirate clan is using a mining outpost as a secret base for their criminal activities. We need you to dock at the station, talk to our agent and then return here without being discovered.
Ok sure, what does the job pay?
The job does not pay that much, only 3000 credits. However, if you are successful, we can offer you much more profitable work. Do you want the job?
Hmmm... that's not much, but I'll take it.
Not a chance, I'm not risking my neck for that!!
Somebody says you are looking for pilot.
Perhaps you'll do... just a mizura... Ok, you check out.
Fine so what needs doing?
We simply need someone to dock at a station in a certain sector.
Sure I can do that, what's the deal?
The station is a secret pirate base in the guise of a factory. We will need you to dock at the station and talk to our 'friend'; and then return here with the information he will give you.
Right... and the job pays what?
The job is easy and pays 3000 credits, if you are successful we can offer you much more profitable work.
Ok I'll take it.
You've got to be kidding!!
You are looking for pilot I understand?
Just a mizura... Ok you check out pilot!
Really! So what needs doing?
You will have to dock at a station a few sectors away from here.
Sounds too easy for words, what's the catch?
The station is a secret pirate base in the guise of a factory. We will need you to dock at the station, talk to our contact and then return here with the information quickly.
Hmm.... and the job pays what?
The job pays 3000 credits, if you return here quickly we can offer you some much more profitable work.
Well Ok, I'll do it.
Not a chance I'm out of here!!
Talk to
The Chance to earn Greater Rewards
Talk to {actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide} on {object.name@L2M600.station}, as a friend tells you that he may have some interesting work and you could earn a few easy credits.
[yellow]Dasinos Yosulis Monisessas VI[/yellow]

Automated Forwarding Service

Message content reads...

 Hello Pilot, if you are reading this message it means that I have had to go into hiding as the {7216,{value@L2M600.PirateName}} Pirate clan now suspects me. This message contains the coded information that you were asked to obtain from me by {actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide}. To avoid suspicion please do not leave the station until you receive another automated message from me.

Code: 20.8.5 24.20.3 20.5.1.13

> Message ends

Automated Forwarding Service

Message content reads...

 Pilot, it should now be safe to depart. Please keep a low profile whilst in this sector, you must not draw attention to yourself in anyway. Please give the code to {actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide}. Good Luck!

> Message ends
[yellow]Dasinos Yosulis Monisessas VI[/yellow]
Avoid attacking any ships whilst in this sector, you do not need to draw attention to yourself. Please give the code to {actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide} on {object.name@L2M600.station}.
[red]Evil Clowns[/red]
[red]Crimson Claws[/red]
[red]Dark Raiders[/red]
[red]Craven Corsairs[/red]
Thanks for returning with the codes... Please wait whilst we verify them.
I have the codes...
Trosulis Gobanis Ganatos VI
[yellow]Trosulis Gobanis Ganatos VI[/yellow]
Please standby whilst we check the code data.
I was asked to contact you by our mutual friend.
Ah yes, she said you might be do us a small favour, for a price of course, but first what we owe you...
Sure, what's the deal... what do you need done?
We would like some passengers collected, you will obviously need life support and enough space, comfort will not be a priority.
Ok, sure it may take a little time, what's the pay?
Hmmm... we can pay you 10,000 credits and a bonus if you get them here quickly. Interested?
Ok, that works for me.
I'm not playing taxi, call a cab!
Here are the codes...
Pick up
Passengers
Standing by!

You are to pick up several passengers from a ship. Once you have them safely on board you are to drop them off where instructed. The captain will not communicate until you are within 5km of the ship.\n\033GYou will need a suitable ship, capable of carrying 36 M class units and have Life Support.\033X

Hello again Pilot, these codes make very interesting reading... a colleague will contact you momentarily, please standby, and he will of course pay you. Thanks again Pilot.\n\n [green]**{actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide} - Out**[/green]
[yellow]{actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide}[/yellow]
Talk to {actor.name@L2M600 Passengers Offer.Guide2}

Hello Pilot, [yellow]{actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide}[/yellow] says that I should speak to you about a payment, and perhaps you may do us another service. Please contact me on the {object.name@L2M600 Passengers Offer.station2}\n\n[green]**Message Ends**[/green]
Juggernaut
Ellenis
Southern Cross
Patris
What is it you want Pilot, I'm very busy...
I understand you have some passengers for me?
Please transmit your authorisation codes...
Transmitting codes now
Hmmm... these seem ok, teleporting passengers to your ship.
Thanks Captain, out!
Drop off

Transfer complete, safe journey Pilot


[green]**{actor.name@L2M600 Passenger Collect accept.Guide3} - Out**[/green]
I'm sorry Pilot, your ship is not suitable, we can talk again once your ship is capable of transporting these men.
\033GOk Pilot we are safely on-board, please take us to {actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide}.\033X
Ok Pilot, thanks for the ride. No doubt {actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide} will be in touch with your money. Ok boys lets go...
Hello again Pilot, here's your money. If you are interested in a little adventure and a lot more money don't leave this system, I'll contact you shortly.
Pilot, if you want to earn yourself some more credits contact me on {object.name@L2M600.station}.
Ok, so what's the job?
I have something a little more tricky this time, if you're interested?
I'm listening.....
We need a scout mission to the sector that contains the Pirate base you docked at earlier, we can pay you 10,000 credits.
and...
and that's it.
You will scout the sector containing the Pirate Base and look for anything out of the ordinary. Once you have finished scouting the sector return here to report.
Scout
Sector {object.sector.name@L2M600.PirateBase}
\033RAttention!!\033X - \033GAdrift ship detected - bearing x={value@L2M600 Adrift Ship.X}m, y={value@L2M600 Adrift Ship.Y}m, z={value@L2M600 Adrift Ship.Z}m\033X
\033RWarning!!\033X - \033GShip unstable, approach with extreme caution!! Data signal weak - approach to within 2km\033X
\033RWarning!!\033X - \033GShip breaking up, locking onto Data source, Data signal weak - approach to within 2km\033X
No Pilot
Magellen
Hallifax
Angre

Pilot, we have received update information on your ship's status and note you have recovered a data module from the {{value@L2M600.Pid},{value@L2M600.ShipName}}. This is of much interest to us, please dock at {object.name@L2M600.station} in sector {object.sector.name@L2M600.station} as quickly as possible... and be careful remember there are pirate ships in that sector maybe using ID cloaks.\n\n[green]**Message Ends**[/green]
You have destroyed the Pirates. Please Return the data module quickly!

Welcome back Pilot, I see you have the module... thanks, here's your money.

Hmm... this data is very odd... hang around Pilot, we may have more work for you to profit from.

[green]**{actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide} - Out**[/green]
[yellow]{actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide}[/yellow]
Flyto
Abandoned TP
Reporting, what can I do for you?
Pilot, you have served us well up to now, perhaps you would like another chance to earn some credits?
Credits are always good, what's the deal?
Excellent, we need a TP class ship. One from our own race for reasons I will not bother you with just now
Ok, so where do I get this TP?
One of our pilots, the coward, abandoned his ship when it mis-jumped to a sector near here...
...and you'd like me to collect it, yes?
You are a quick one... yes we'd like you to collect the ship.
Hmmm what's the pay?
We can pay you 10000 credits.
Ok, give me the coordinates and I'll go get your ship.
No way not for all the space weed in... well... everywhere!
One of our pilots, the coward, abandoned his ship went it mis-jumped to a sector near here. We would like you to go and collect it.
{7216,2600123}\n\033GThe ship is located in sector {sector.name@{player.sector}}.\033X
Coward! Get out of our sight.
Star of Destiny
The Dreamweaver
The Pelenum
Go away! This prize is ours if you come any closer we will destroy you!!
You'd better try and reason with these Scavengers first, we don't know how many ships they have in this area and we can't risk the TP being damaged.\n\nContact the lead Pirate and try and bluff him.
This is...
We do not care who you are! This ship is ours, go away.
Ok, I was just going to say that the ship is contaminated with... oh well, you don't care...
What!! What do you mean?
Well the ship is a medical transport and was off to be sterilised after all the patients died horribly of {param@L2M600Backdown.Disease}.
What!? Are you serious?
Yep, I was just coming to see how bad it was, and I can see from my bio-scanners it really is BAD!
Show us the readings... NOW!!
Ok, transmitting readings [Transmit Dummy Readings]
Fin Fungus (Boron)
Argon Flu (Argon)
Rmancklt aka "Jelly Bones" (Paranid)
Irrational Space Fear (Teladi)
Thramatack aka "Brown Death" (Split)
Space Lung (Generic for all other Races)
Take the plague ridden hulk, just get it out of our space.
Idiot, these readings are as fake a teladi pyramid scheme. Now you die!
[red]{actor.name@L2M600.PirateLeader}[/red]
\033GQuickly get the TP and bring it back before their friends arrive.\033X
Huritis Ganatos Dasinos VI (teladi)
Yusmaeos Lalundas Hirussusis III (teladi)
Foologos Yalamandis Hohindras XV (teladi)
Brent Silsarna (argon)
Mayenne Nedley (argon)
Pael Sillarn (argon)
Toto Fi (boron)
Mumi Pu (boron)
Trali Wo (boron)
Mo't Nnt (split)
Cio't Sht (split)
Lo't Knt (split)
Tammanckagtek (paranid)
Abmanckussut (paranid)
Imanckettiks (paranid)

Help, I'm over here... oh praise the great maker, when those scavengers turned up I thought I was a dead man. I am hiding in one of the crates floating near the TP, please if you can take me back to the {object.name@L2M600.station} in {object.sector.name@L2M600.station}. I can pay you.

I can also give you some information of value, and perhaps fix the shields and weapons on that TP.

Please pick me up once you have claimed the TP.

Thank you, you won't regret your decision to pick me up.

I have fixed your engines and shields and managed to restore some power to the weapons, however the jumpdrive is unstable and I have taken it off-line.

By the way my name is {{value@L2M600.Pid},{value@L2M600 return TP.rescuepilot}}.
Fly the TP back to the {object.name@L2M600.station} in sector {object.sector.name@L2M600.station} for {actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide} as quickly as possible and dock.

Welcome back Pilot you're just in time; we need you to fly us to the Pirate station masquerading as the {object.name@L2M600.PirateBase}. You will be transporting myself and these men you picked up earlier, as you have probably gathered by now we aren't exactly tourists. Myself and my men are on a rescue mission, you may have read on GNS that {value@L2M600.kidnap} has been kidnapped.

We are an elite covert {lookup.race.name@{value@L2M600.OfferRace}} assault squad sent to rescue them. You are to fly us to the Pirate Station, once in range you will be challenged and you will give them these landing codes, we are listed as a medical transport. Once we've boarded we'll take out the communications and rescue {value@L2M600.kidnap} and return to the ship where you will fly us safely back here.

Ok then let's go.

We will need to arrive unescorted else they will smell a rat, so leave any of your fighters here.
This is Station control, please be advised this station is closed to all but medical personnel, if you have a medical registration please contact us.
[yellow]{object.name@L2M600.PirateBase} control[/yellow]

Psst... Pilot it's me {{value@L2M600.Pid},{value@L2M600 return TP.rescuepilot}}, thanks for bringing me here, as I promised here's your money... oh and a piece of advice don't trust {actor.name@L2M600 Create Offer.Guide} too far, he's not all he seems.
This is medical transporter {param@L2M600.HospShipName} requesting permission to land.
Hand of Mercy
Hospital Ship #512
Plague Runner
Standby, reading code information...
Holding at outer markers...
Your codes check out, please approach and dock at the first available bay.
Affirmative Control

Defend Sector from Pirates
Our scanners show that the pirates are on their way. Try to keep as many of them busy as you can. Don't lose control over the sector!

Here they come! Bandits inbound... Pilot, show them what you've got! Remember that you not only have to kill as many as possible but also protect the freighters and prevent the pirate ships from escaping. You have to help hold the sector until the military arrives!
Intercept the fleeing pirates!
Good work, pilot. Those pirates have taken quite a beating! Report back to the {object.name@L2M003XTC.OfferStation} for a debriefing.
Great work, pilot. The {lookup.race.name@pirate} clan will think twice about trying to raid this sector next time! The military will take care of all the rest. Transferring your reward now.
What the hell are you doing, pilot? You're on a mission, remember? You can't simply leave the area! Forget your payment, this mission was a failure. No, in fact, you are the failure here!

I've never seen a failure like this! This is a catastrophe! You let way too many of them escape. This will encourage them to raid us again! Forget the payment! You can feel lucky that we don't make you pay up for the damage you've done!

Hey, what gives? We had a pretty basic deal, you and I! You were supposed to go where I told you to go, right now, and you said you would, but I am not seeing you there! Forget the deal, if you can't sort out basic navigation, then turn to planetside farming, kid!

We should have known that you would be in league with the pirates. Your attack on our station led to the demise of your former employer, and now we know where your allegiance stands! You have been reported to the authorities, and rest assured, when we get hold of the bounty hunters, you will be top of the list... you treacherous worm!
Defend freighters in the sector {sector.name@L2M003XTC.MissionSector}.
{lookup.race.name@pirate} {35,2110}.

So, are you interested or not?
Yes, I have received the report on the mission.
Hello. I heard you may be in need of a mercenary?
Right, understood. So, will you give me any information on the job or not?
Sounds like we have a deal... I'll try to do the mission, but you better pay me well.
Oh dear, will you look at the time... Sorry, but I don't wish to partake in such activities.
Register me for the report!
Pirate raid repulsed.
Piracy operation successful.

The latest raid against our targets in {sector.name@L2M003XTC.MissionSector} was an utter failure! Based on their performance, we are ashamed to call the family involved in the assault a clan, they would seem to be no better than mere slaves!

Thanks to their stellar defeat, we are now left with a ruined reputation. How can we extort station owners when they think we're such pushovers? But rest assured brethren, for our end is not nigh. The responsible clan has been dealt with, and the names of mercenaries who aided in defending the sector from our little operation have been noted and distributed amongst the bounty hunters. They will be tracked down and vengeance shall be ours.

Pirate Rhb t'Nkkst

The latest operation against our enemies in {sector.name@L2M003XTC.MissionSector} was a complete success! We are more than proud to call the pirate clan involved in the raid a true family with proud piracy traditions running deep in their blood! For their efforts, they have gained great renown among our brethren.

The final result was greater than we could have anticipated, more than 17 new station owners have accepted our protection services, and they will now provide much needed financial aid for our cause. Of course, some lives were lost in the assault, and no true pirate will allow the death of his brothers to stay unpunished. Our spies in the area have noted the names of all non-military combat ships involved, as well as their deeds and number of our folk slain. Our greater collective will issue a bounty on their heads, ensuring a swift vengeance.

Pirate Rhb t'Nkkst
Sector is protected from pirate raiders!
Pirates successfully assault a whole sector!

A long planned pirate raid was successfully neutralised in {sector.name@L2M003XTC.MissionSector}. It seems that the pirates of a well-known clan had chosen the sector as a place for both warning and punishment. They warned the station owners what would happen if they didn't pay for so-called 'protection', and then punished those that refused to pay.

That was the plan at least, but luckily the invasion was dealt with in a swift and decisive manner. A local station manager realising that military ships calling for defence of the sector would not be able to arrive in time, issued a call for help on the regular communication channel. By chance, several mercenaries picked up the signal and agreed to hold off the pirate raiders until the arrival of the military forces. The defence was successful, and although there were heavy casualties on both sides, the captain of the defending military fleet reported that all of the mercenaries had acted as real professionals, and that everyone should be proud to fly in the same space that these brave men traverse.

Rity Fist - GalNet News

Unfortunately, we have to bring bad news to our readers. A pirate fleet recently entered {sector.name@L2M003XTC.MissionSector} and devastated everything there simply to show their might and influence over the area. The local military force commander said that he was aware of the impending raid, but there was no chance whatsoever for him to make it to the combat zone in time to prevent civilian casualties.

The most unfortunate part of this is that the death of hundreds of civilians could have been prevented, if only more mercenaries had responded to the emergency call for help issued just before the assault. Analysts claim that the pirates gained the upper hand by pure chance, and if there had even been just one more mercenary willing to defend, the whole invasion could have been prevented and the pirates would never have had the chance to escape with their lives. Now, we are left with only one question. Are there really no more heroes in the space lanes? What has happened to the fabled freelancers, pilots of exceptional skill and combat prowess? Are they now just mere illusions of past times? This event appears to give us only one glaringly painful answer... yes.

Rity Fist - GalNet News

(Briefing: Text - Meet Stricken Ship)The Sea of Tears has been attacked by Pirates and is in need of urgent assistance. You are to rendezvous with the stricken ship in the Conrad sector. You will have to get to within 8km to communicate with them as their comms transmitter is failing.
(Custom Action) Rendezvous with:
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)Calling the Sea of Tears........
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)Thank the Queen! We have been attacked by pirates and our engines damaged, we desperately need some engine components that were fried in the attack....
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)...and you would like me to fetch these for you?
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)Yes, but it may not be that easy. The only place you will be able to obtain these around here is from a Teladi by the name of Tzessosis Hirussusis Yoyunis XIII.
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)Oh... and he will be difficult I assume.....?
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)He? No, No... she, no male Teladi in space... however yes 'she' will no doubt be difficult, but you must procure these parts at all cost.
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)I see, so what's in it for me?
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)Apart from our gratitude, we can make certain pieces of equipment available to you and pay you 10,000 credits.
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)What sort of equipment?
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)Bring back the computer components we need and we can discuss that, so will you help us?
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)Hmm... where do I find this Teladi?
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01)You can find her in sector Atropos II on the Teladi Trade Dock.
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01 - accept mission)Ok sure for 10,000 and some new equipment, I'll help.... be back as soon as I have the components.
(conversation: L2M900GagaPi01 - reject mission)Not a chance I'm not hauling my carcass all the way over to Atropos II for a piddling 10,000 credits.

(Goodbye if Player reject mission)It seems we don't need you help after all, your loss dry skin!

(Briefing: Text - Tzessosis Hirussusis Yoyunis XIII)You are to meet with \033YTzessosis Hirussusis Yoyunis XIII\033X on the Teladi Trading Station and convince her to give you the parts the {7216,2900005} needs to get underway.
(Subtitle)\033GSea of Tears\033X : We are now shutting down our comms transmitter until you come back to conserve power... Good Luck!
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)Hello I wish to speak to Tzessosis Hirussusis Yoyunis XIII...
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)This is Tzessosis Hirussusis Yoyunis XIII, what do you want pink skin?
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)Just the chance to make profit with the Teladi.
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)Ah you know how to speak to a Teladi properly I see, so what can the Teladi do for you?
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)I am in need of some specialist engine components, the type used on a Boron Orca.
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)Hmmm I see, not common in this part of space, very expensive..... 500,000 credits.
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)Are you mad....sorry I mean too much for me to make a profit on.
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)*Laugh* I see you have dealt with the Teladi before, well perhaps we could come to another arrangement?
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)What sort of arrangement?
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)I need a parcel collected, a simple matter, from a Split from whom I will not speak to directly for reasons that do not matter.
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)And I get to pick it up from him...
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)You learn quickly for a pink skin.
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01 - briefing action)Ok! Who is this Split and where do I find him?
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)His name is Cai't Plp, as to where you can find him, that's another matter, I can tell you where he was last seen.
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)I don't understand...
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)Cai't Plp, is on the run for the authorities, you will have to track him down... you can get details from the GNS of his last known position.
(conversation: L2M900Tzessosis01)Ok, let me see what I can do.
(GNS Mission Article - Title)\033OKnown Criminal Escapes Authorities\033X

(GNS Mission Article - Text)Cai't Plp has once again evaded capture by the Teladi Authorities, he was last seen in sector 'Unforeseen Expenses' on the Trade Station and was thought to be in the company of Cio't Hnk for much of his time there.

Teladi Authorities have classified this Split as a \033R'Danger to Profit'\033X and should be detained at all costs; if you have any information on this insidious criminal then you should contact the Teladi Military at once.
